title: DevOps Review: ABQ operational concerns
description:
Operational review:
- Installation/setup complexity
- Resource usage (CPU, memory, disk)
- Monitoring/observability hooks
- Failure modes and recovery
- Cross-platform compatibility
- CI/CD integration
- Would you want to support this in production?

title: Update Python badge to 3.11 (FreeBSD default)
description: README badge updated from pypi/pyversions to static python-3.11 badge matching FreeBSD default. Already done, needs push.

title: Add code coverage reporting to CI
description: Add pytest-cov coverage reporting. Update CI workflow to upload coverage. Codecov badge already in README.

title: Research: Agent Communication Protocols Survey
description:
Comprehensive research on agent communication protocols and patterns for ABQ.

## Key Relevant Papers

### Agent Interoperability
- **arxiv:2505.02279** - Survey of Agent Interoperability Protocols: MCP, ACP, A2A, ANP
  Compares Model Context Protocol, Agent Communication Protocol, Agent-to-Agent, and Agent Network Protocol

- **arxiv:2502.14321** - Beyond Self-Talk: A Communication-Centric Survey of LLM-Based Multi-Agent Systems
  Communication primitives: message, state, action types

### Message Queues
- **arxiv:1704.00411** - A Survey of Distributed Message Broker Queues
  Covers RabbitMQ, Kafka, ZeroMQ - useful for comparison

### Swarm Intelligence
- **arxiv:2510.10047** - SwarmSys: Multi-Agent Communication Protocol
  Decentralized coordination patterns

### Foundational
- **FIPA-ACL** (fipa.org) - Foundation for Intelligent Physical Agents
  Original agent communication language standard from 2002

### Design Influences
- **Efrit** (github.com/steveyegge/efrit) - Direct inspiration for file-based queue
- **Maildir** (cr.yp.to/proto/maildir.html) - Atomic file creation pattern
- **Unix spool** - Classic /var/spool pattern

## Not Relevant (reviewed and excluded)
- arxiv:2512.18202 (Sophia) - Individual agent persistence, not communication
- arxiv:2508.13171 (Cognitive Workspace) - Individual LLM memory management

## Status
Research complete. Key findings integrated into README.org Research section.

title: Add abq sync-remote command for multi-host rsync
description:
Wrap rsync for syncing ~/.abq/channels/ between hosts.

Usage:
  abq sync-remote <host> [up|down|both]

Examples:
  abq sync-remote nexus up     # push to nexus
  abq sync-remote nexus down   # pull from nexus  
  abq sync-remote nexus both   # bidirectional

Implementation: simple bash wrapper or add to CLI.
See docs/MULTI_HOST.org for context.

title: Fix recv() race condition in core.py
description: P0 release blocker. core.py:224-229: read+rename without try/except. Two concurrent receivers can both read the same file before either renames it. Add try/except FileNotFoundError around file read and rename, retry on conflict.

title: Add abq check command for health/validation
description:
User tried 'abq check' but command doesn't exist.

Suggested implementation:
- Run abq status
- Validate registry.json schema
- Check for stale messages (older than TTL)
- Verify channel directory permissions
- Optional: run tests if in dev environment

Similar to 'git fsck' or 'docker system check'.

title: CTO Review: ABQ architecture and strategy
description:
Review ABQ for strategic alignment:
- Does this solve a real problem?
- Architecture decisions sound?
- Competitive landscape (alternatives exist?)
- Open source strategy alignment
- Potential for community adoption
- Resource investment vs benefit

title: Add abq requeue command for stuck messages
description:
Move messages from processing/ back to requests/ for retry.

Usage:
  abq requeue <channel>           - requeue all stuck
  abq requeue <channel> <msg_id>  - requeue specific message

Useful when handler crashed mid-processing.

title: Fix CI lint: unsorted imports in __init__.py

title: Add pre-commit hooks for lint and typecheck
description: Add pre-commit hook integration to run ruff check and mypy before commits. Options: (1) extend existing .git/hooks/pre-commit with lint/typecheck steps, (2) use pre-commit framework (pre-commit.com) with .pre-commit-config.yaml. Current pre-commit hook only handles beads sync and detangle guard. Should catch lint/type errors locally before pushing to CI.

title: L7 Review: ABQ code quality and design
description:
Senior engineer review:
- Code quality and style
- API design (CLI, Python library)
- Test coverage adequate?
- Documentation quality
- Extensibility/maintainability
- Edge cases handled?
- Would you be proud to have your name on this?

title: Security Review: ABQ threat model
description:
Security assessment:
- File permission model adequate?
- Input validation (JSON parsing)
- Command injection risks (handlers)
- Secrets exposure risk
- Trust boundaries clear?
- Any CVE-worthy issues?
- Safe for public deployment?

title: Session summary: Graphviz state machine, abq.el, bidirectional tangle, security neutralization
description:
Session completed the following work:

1. **Graphviz state machine** — Added `#+begin_src dot :file docs/abq-state-machine.png :tangle docs/abq-state-machine.dot :comments link` block to abq-spec.org under ** State Machine section. Shows full message lifecycle: sender → requests/ → processing/ → agent handler → responses/ + archive/.

2. **abq.el** — New Emacs Lisp package with: abq-dot-export, abq-org-babel-setup, abq-render-state-machine, abq-tangle-and-render, font-lock for ABQ message types/directory names, abq-mode minor mode, auto-activates on ABQ org files.

3. **Bidirectional tangle/detangle** — :comments link on dot block enables org-babel-detangle. Tangle maps dot→c-mode via org-src-lang-modes for // comment syntax. Makefile has tangle, detangle, dot-render, dot-tangle targets with workflow docs. Generated files (docs/*.dot, *.png, *.svg) added to .gitignore. Pre-commit hook warns if generated files staged without abq-spec.org change.

4. **REMOTE_HOST .env config** — Replaced hardcoded hydrabos with -include .env and .env.template. Non-phony `gmake .env` target copies template. Sync targets guard on REMOTE_HOST being set.

5. **Security neutralization** — All hostnames (hydra, nexus, hydrabos, nexusbos), Tailscale references, specific OS patch levels, and repo paths replaced with generic placeholders (host-a, host-b, $REMOTE_HOST) across MULTI_HOST.org, TEST_PLAN.org, ADR 001, and cli.py. Actual config stays in .env (gitignored).

Commits: 98f2dfc, 9e85283→rebased, 95404c3, 001223b

title: Verify CI coverage upload works after fixes
description: After lint+typecheck fixes land, confirm the test job runs coverage and uploads to Codecov successfully.

title: Add abq gc/prune command for stale message cleanup
description:
After 'abq check' finds stale messages, agent needs a way to clean them.

Options:
1. abq gc              - garbage collect all stale (past TTL)
2. abq gc --dry-run    - show what would be removed
3. abq gc --force      - remove even if not past TTL
4. abq prune <channel> - prune specific channel

Should archive, not delete (recoverable).

title: Add local code coverage reporting
description: Add local coverage workflow: gmake test-cov target already exists but verify it works, add coverage.xml to .gitignore, consider adding coverage badge from Codecov. CI already uploads to Codecov on Python 3.12 runs. Verify Codecov integration works after CI goes green (blocked by agent-bus-ose).

title: Fix watcher: pyinotify not detected on FreeBSD 15
Legal Review: ABQ repo public release
description:
Review ABQ codebase for:
- License compliance (MIT)
- No proprietary code or trade secrets
- No liability concerns in documentation
- Humor/jokes are appropriate for public consumption
- No references to real companies/people that could cause issues

title: Fix CI typecheck: 5 mypy no-any-return errors
description: CI typecheck job fails with 5 mypy no-any-return errors in core.py (lines 93,97,98,230) and cli.py (line 39). Functions return Any where typed return is declared.
